mdRecord.dcterms:title: Photograph of Congressman Moore with Bridgeport School Boy Patrol
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Congressman Arch A. Moore, Jr. (center) with the Bridgeport School Boys Patrol in the Statuary Hall at the Capitol. Moore is flanked by Bridgeport Police Chief John H. Diamond and Thomas D. Kinney. The second statue from the right is that of Francis H. Pierpont, first governor of the restored government of Virginia who was elected to that post in 1861 by delegates at the Wheeling Constitutional Assembly.
